Here's what you need to do:

1. **Add Allure Gauge plugin to your `manifest.json`:**

<augment_code_snippet path="manifest.json" mode="EDIT">
```json
{
 "Language": "java",
 "Plugins": [
 "html-report",
 "allure"
 ]
}
```
</augment_code_snippet>

2. **Add Allure dependencies to your `pom.xml`:**

<augment_code_snippet path="pom.xml" mode="EDIT">
```xml
<dependency>
 <groupId>io.qameta.allure</groupId>
 <artifactId>allure-gauge</artifactId>
 <version>2.29.1</version>
</dependency>
<dependency>
 <groupId>io.qameta.allure</groupId>
 <artifactId>allure-junit5</artifactId>
 <version>2.29.1</version>
</dependency>
```
</augment_code_snippet>

3. **Add Allure Maven plugin to your build section:**

<augment_code_snippet path="pom.xml" mode="EDIT">
```xml
<plugin>
 <groupId>io.qameta.allure</groupId>
 <artifactId>allure-maven</artifactId>
 <version>2.12.0</version>
 <configuration>
 <reportVersion>2.29.1</reportVersion>
 </configuration>
</plugin>
```
</augment_code_snippet>

4. **Install the Allure plugin:**
```bash
gauge install allure
```

5. **Generate and view Allure reports:**
```bash
# Run tests
gauge run specs

# Generate Allure report
mvn allure:report

# Serve Allure report
mvn allure:serve
```

The Allure reports will be generated in the `target/allure-results` directory and the HTML report in `target/site/allure-maven-plugin`.

1. **Add Allure Gauge plugin to your `manifest.json`:**

````json path=manifest.json mode=EDIT
{
 "Language": "java",
 "Plugins": [
 "html-report",
 "allure"
 ]

````

2. **Add Allure dependencies to your `pom.xml`:**

````xml path=pom.xml mode=EDIT
<dependency>
 <groupId>io.qameta.allure</groupId>
 <artifactId>allure-gauge</artifactId>

</dependency>
<dependency>
 <groupId>io.qameta.allure</groupId>

````xml path=pom.xml mode=EDIT

 <reportVersion>2.29.1</reportVersion>
 </configuration>

````

```bash
gauge install allure
```

```bash
# Run tests

mvn allure:report

mvn allure:serve
```

The Allure reports will be generated in the `target/allure-results` directory and the HTML report in `target/site/allure-maven-plugin`.

This failure was cached in the local repository and resolution is not reattempted until the update interval of central has elapsed or updates are forced"},{"type":"hardBreak"}]}]},"mentioned_items":[],"structured_output_nodes":[{"id":1,"type":0,"content":"The error indicates that the `allure-gauge` dependency version `2.29.1` is not available in Maven Central. Let's fix this by using a compatible version.

Update your `pom.xml` with the correct Allure Gauge version:

<augment_code_snippet path="pom.xml" mode="EDIT">
```xml
<dependency>
 <groupId>io.qameta.allure</groupId>
 <artifactId>allure-gauge</artifactId>
 <version>2.24.0</version>
</dependency>
<dependency>
 <groupId>io.qameta.allure</groupId>
 <artifactId>allure-junit5</artifactId>
 <version>2.29.1</version>
</dependency>
```
</augment_code_snippet>

Then run:
```bash
mvn clean install -U
```

The `-U` flag forces Maven to update snapshots and check for newer versions. The `allure-gauge` plugin typically lags behind the main Allure releases, so version `2.24.0` should be available and compatible with your setup.

If you still encounter issues, you can also try version `2.20.1` which is known to be stable with Gauge projects.

 </includes>
 </configuration>
</plugin>
```

can I hooks file for my project and how it would be","rich_text_json_repr":{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"How can I hooks file for my project and how it would be"}]}]},"mentioned_items":[],"structured_output_nodes":[{"id":1,"type":0,"content":"You can create hooks for your Gauge project by adding them to your `BaseTest.java` file or creating a separate hooks class. Here's how to enhance your project with proper hooks:

<augment_code_snippet path="src/main/java/tests/BaseTest.java" mode="EDIT">
```java
package tests;

import com.thoughtworks.gauge.*;
import org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver;
import utils.*;
import io.qameta.allure.Allure;

public class BaseTest {
 protected static WebDriver driver;
 protected static ElementLocatorReader locatorReader;

 @BeforeSuite
 public void beforeSuite() {
 System.out.println("Test suite balatlyor...");
 // Global setup ilemleri
 }

 @BeforeSpec
 public void beforeSpec() {
 System.out.println("Spec balatlyor...");
 }

 @BeforeScenario
 public void beforeScenario() throws Exception {
 System.out.println("Scenario balatlyor...");
 DriverFactory.clearDownloadDir();
 driver = DriverFactory.getDriver();

 if (locatorReader == null) {
 locatorReader = new ElementLocatorReader(
 "KapHomePage.json",
 "QueryPage.json", 
 "ResultsPage.json",
 "NotificationDetailsPage.json"
 );
 }
 }

 @BeforeStep
 public void beforeStep(ExecutionContext context) {
 System.out.println("Step balatlyor: " + context.getCurrentStep().getText());
 }

 @AfterStep
 public void afterStep(ExecutionContext context) {
 // Her step sonras screenshot al
 if (driver != null) {
 ScreenshotUtils.takeScreenshot(driver, context.getCurrentStep().getText());
 }
 }

 @AfterScenario
 public void afterScenario(ExecutionContext context) {
 System.out.println("Scenario tamamland...");
 if (context.getCurrentScenario().getIsFailing()) {
 // Hata durumunda screenshot al
 ScreenshotUtils.takeFailureScreenshot(driver);
 }
 DriverFactory.quitDriver();
 }

 @AfterSpec
 public void afterSpec() {
 System.out.println("Spec tamamland...");
 }

 @AfterSuite
 public void afterSuite() {
 System.out.println("Test suite tamamland...");
 AllureReportGenerator.generateReport();
 }
}
```
</augment_code_snippet>

Also create a utility class for screenshots:

<augment_code_snippet path="src/main/java/utils/ScreenshotUtils.java" mode="EDIT">
```java
package utils;

import org.openqa.selenium.OutputType;
import org.openqa.selenium.TakesScreenshot;
import org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver;
import io.qameta.allure.Allure;

import java.io.ByteArrayInputStream;
import java.io.File;
import java.io.IOException;
import java.nio.file.Files;
import java.time.LocalDateTime;
import java.time.format.DateTimeFormatter;

public class ScreenshotUtils {
 
 public static void takeScreenshot(WebDriver driver, String stepName) {
 if (driver != null) {
 try {
 byte[] screenshot = ((TakesScreenshot) driver).getScreenshotAs(OutputType.BYTES);
 Allure.addAttachment("Screenshot - " + stepName, new ByteArrayInputStream(screenshot));
 } catch (Exception e) {
 System.err.println("Screenshot alnamad: " + e.getMessage());
 }
 }
 }
 
 public static void takeFailureScreenshot(WebDriver driver) {
 if (driver != null) {
 try {
 byte[] screenshot = ((TakesScreenshot) driver).getScreenshotAs(OutputType.BYTES);
 Allure.addAttachment("Failure Screenshot", new ByteArrayInputStream(screenshot));
 } catch (Exception e) {
 System.err.println("Failure screenshot alnamad: " + e.getMessage());
 }
 }
 }
}
```
</augment_code_snippet>

The hooks will automatically:
- Set up driver before each scenario
- Take screenshots after each step and on failures
- Clean up resources after scenarios
- Generate Allure reports after the suite completes

ERROR io.qameta.allure.AllureLifecycle - Could not add attachment: no test is running
","rich_text_json_repr":{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"[pool-2-thread-1] ERROR io.qameta.allure.AllureLifecycle - Could not add attachment: no test is running"},{"type":"hardBreak"}]}]},"mentioned_items":[],"structured_output_nodes":[{"id":1,"type":0,"content":"The error "Could not add attachment: no test is running" occurs because Allure is trying to attach screenshots when there's no active Allure test context. This happens when using Gauge with Allure integration.

To fix this, you need to properly integrate Allure with Gauge. Update your `ScreenshotUtils.java`:

<augment_code_snippet path="src/main/java/utils/ScreenshotUtils.java" mode="EDIT">
```java
public static void takeScreenshot(WebDriver driver, String stepName) {
 if (driver != null) {
 try {
 byte[] screenshot = ((TakesScreenshot) driver).getScreenshotAs(OutputType.BYTES);
 
 // Check if Allure lifecycle is active
 try {
 Allure.addAttachment("Screenshot - " + stepName, "image/png", new ByteArrayInputStream(screenshot), ".png");
 } catch (Exception allureException) {
 // Fallback: save to file system
 saveScreenshotToFile(screenshot, stepName);
 }
 } catch (Exception e) {
 System.err.println("Screenshot alnamad: " + e.getMessage());
 }
 }
}

public static void takeFailureScreenshot(WebDriver driver) {
 if (driver != null) {
 try {
 byte[] screenshot = ((TakesScreenshot) driver).getScreenshotAs(OutputType.BYTES);
 
 try {
 Allure.addAttachment("Failure Screenshot", "image/png", new ByteArrayInputStream(screenshot), ".png");
 } catch (Exception allureException) {
 saveScreenshotToFile(screenshot, "failure");
 }
 } catch (Exception e) {
 System.err.println("Failure screenshot alnamad: " + e.getMessage());
 }
 }
}

private static void saveScreenshotToFile(byte[] screenshot, String stepName) {
 try {
 String timestamp = LocalDateTime.now().format(DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("yyyyMMdd_HHmmss"));
 String fileName = "screenshot_" + stepName.replaceAll("[^a-zA-Z0-9]", "_") + "_" + timestamp + ".png";
 File screenshotFile = new File("target/screenshots/" + fileName);
 screenshotFile.getParentFile().mkdirs();
 Files.write(screenshotFile.toPath(), screenshot);
 System.out.println("Screenshot saved: " + screenshotFile.getAbsolutePath());
 } catch (IOException e) {
 System.err.println("Could not save screenshot: " + e.getMessage());
 }
}
```
</augment_code_snippet>

Also, make sure you have the correct Allure Gauge integration in your `pom.xml`:

<augment_code_snippet path="pom.xml" mode="EDIT">
```xml
<dependency>
 <groupId>io.qameta.allure</groupId>
 <artifactId>allure-gauge</artifactId>
 <version>2.24.0</version>
</dependency>
```
</augment_code_snippet>

This will handle the Allure lifecycle properly and provide a fallback to save screenshots to the file system when Allure context is not available.

For Gauge projects with Allure integration, you should use the Allure plugin for Gauge instead of the Maven dependency.

Remove the `allure-gauge` dependency from your `pom.xml` and keep only the core Allure dependencies:

<augment_code_snippet path="pom.xml" mode="EDIT">
```xml
<dependency>
 <groupId>io.qameta.allure</groupId>
 <artifactId>allure-java-commons</artifactId>
 <version>2.29.1</version>
</dependency>
```
</augment_code_snippet>

Then install the Allure plugin for Gauge:

```bash
gauge install allure
```

Make sure your `manifest.json` includes the allure plugin:

<augment_code_snippet path="manifest.json" mode="EDIT">
```json
{
 "Language": "java",
 "Plugins": [
 "html-report",
 "allure",
 "xml-report"
 ],
 "EnvironmentDir": ""
}
```
</augment_code_snippet>

The Allure integration will work through the Gauge plugin rather than Maven dependencies. Your screenshots and reports will be handled by the plugin automatically.

390x844","rich_text_json_repr":{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"I wanna add properties to pom.xml for the scenario will start on desktop or mobile. if desktop selected then window size should be 1920x1080 or mobile selected windows size should be 390x844"}]}]},"mentioned_items":[],"structured_output_nodes":[{"id":1,"type":0,"content":"You can add properties to your `pom.xml` to control desktop/mobile mode and window sizes. Here's how to configure it:

<augment_code_snippet path="pom.xml" mode="EDIT">
```xml
<properties>
 <browser>chrome</browser>
 <mode>desktop</mode>
 <desktop.width>1920</desktop.width>
 <desktop.height>1080</desktop.height>
 <mobile.width>390</mobile.width>
 <mobile.height>844</mobile.height>
</properties>
```
</augment_code_snippet>

Then update your `DriverFactory.java` to use these properties:

<augment_code_snippet path="src/main/java/utils/DriverFactory.java" mode="EDIT">
```java
public static WebDriver getDriver() {
 if (driver == null) {
 createDownloadDir();

 String browser = System.getProperty("browser", "chrome");
 String mode = System.getProperty("mode", "desktop");

 switch (browser.toLowerCase()) {
 case "firefox":
 WebDriverManager.firefoxdriver().setup();
 FirefoxOptions ffOptions = new FirefoxOptions();
 driver = new FirefoxDriver(ffOptions);
 setViewport(driver, mode);
 break;

 case "chrome":
 default:
 WebDriverManager.chromedriver().setup();
 ChromeOptions chromeOptions = new ChromeOptions();

 Map<String, Object> prefs = new HashMap<>();
 prefs.put("download.default_directory", downloadDir);
 prefs.put("download.prompt_for_download", false);
 prefs.put("safebrowsing.enabled", true);
 chromeOptions.setExperimentalOption("prefs", prefs);

 if (mode.equalsIgnoreCase("mobile")) {
 int mobileWidth = Integer.parseInt(System.getProperty("mobile.width", "390"));
 int mobileHeight = Integer.parseInt(System.getProperty("mobile.height", "844"));
 
 Map<String, Object> deviceMetrics = new HashMap<>();
 deviceMetrics.put("width", mobileWidth);
 deviceMetrics.put("height", mobileHeight);
 deviceMetrics.put("pixelRatio", 3.0);

 Map<String, Object> mobileEmulation = new HashMap<>();
 mobileEmulation.put("deviceMetrics", deviceMetrics);
 mobileEmulation.put("userAgent",
 "Mozilla/5.0 (iPhone; CPU iPhone OS 13_5 like Mac OS X) " +
 "AppleWebKit/605.1.15 (KHTML, like Gecko) Version/13.1.1 Mobile/15E148 Safari/604.1");

 chromeOptions.setExperimentalOption("mobileEmulation", mobileEmulation);
 } else {
 int desktopWidth = Integer.parseInt(System.getProperty("desktop.width", "1920"));
 int desktopHeight = Integer.parseInt(System.getProperty("desktop.height", "1080"));
 chromeOptions.addArguments("window-size=" + desktopWidth + "," + desktopHeight);
 }

 driver = new ChromeDriver(chromeOptions);
 break;
 }
 }
 return driver;
}

private static void setViewport(WebDriver driver, String mode) {
 if (mode.equalsIgnoreCase("mobile")) {
 int mobileWidth = Integer.parseInt(System.getProperty("mobile.width", "390"));
 int mobileHeight = Integer.parseInt(System.getProperty("mobile.height", "844"));
 driver.manage().window().setSize(new Dimension(mobileWidth, mobileHeight));
 } else {
 int desktopWidth = Integer.parseInt(System.getProperty("desktop.width", "1920"));
 int desktopHeight = Integer.parseInt(System.getProperty("desktop.height", "1080"));
 driver.manage().window().setSize(new Dimension(desktopWidth, desktopHeight));
 }
}
```

# Custom sizes

```

public static WebDriver getDriver() {
 if (driver == null) {
 createDownloadDir();

 String browser = System.getProperty("browser", "chrome");
 String mode = System.getProperty("mode", "desktop");

 switch (browser.toLowerCase()) {
 case "firefox":
 WebDriverManager.firefoxdriver().setup();
 FirefoxOptions ffOptions = new FirefoxOptions();
 driver = new FirefoxDriver(ffOptions);
 setViewport(driver, mode);
 break;

 case "chrome":
 default:
 WebDriverManager.chromedriver().setup();
 ChromeOptions chromeOptions = new ChromeOptions();

 Map<String, Object> prefs = new HashMap<>();
 prefs.put("download.default_directory", downloadDir);
 prefs.put("download.prompt_for_download", false);
 prefs.put("safebrowsing.enabled", true);
 chromeOptions.setExperimentalOption("prefs", prefs);

 if (mode.equalsIgnoreCase("mobile")) {
 int mobileWidth = Integer.parseInt(System.getProperty("mobile.width", "390"));
 int mobileHeight = Integer.parseInt(System.getProperty("mobile.height", "844"));
 
 Map<String, Object> deviceMetrics = new HashMap<>();
 deviceMetrics.put("width", mobileWidth);
 deviceMetrics.put("height", mobileHeight);
 deviceMetrics.put("pixelRatio", 3.0);

 Map<String, Object> mobileEmulation = new HashMap<>();
 mobileEmulation.put("deviceMetrics", deviceMetrics);
 mobileEmulation.put("userAgent",
 "Mozilla/5.0 (iPhone; CPU iPhone OS 13_5 like Mac OS X) " +
 "AppleWebKit/605.1.15 (KHTML, like Gecko) Version/13.1.1 Mobile/15E148 Safari/604.1");

 chromeOptions.setExperimentalOption("mobileEmulation", mobileEmulation);
 } else {
 int desktopWidth = Integer.parseInt(System.getProperty("desktop.width", "1920"));
 int desktopHeight = Integer.parseInt(System.getProperty("desktop.height", "1080"));
 chromeOptions.addArguments("window-size=" + desktopWidth + "," + desktopHeight);
 }

 driver = new ChromeDriver(chromeOptions);
 break;
 }
 }
 return driver;
}

private static void setViewport(WebDriver driver, String mode) {
 if (mode.equalsIgnoreCase("mobile")) {
 int mobileWidth = Integer.parseInt(System.getProperty("mobile.width", "390"));
 int mobileHeight = Integer.parseInt(System.getProperty("mobile.height", "844"));
 driver.manage().window().setSize(new Dimension(mobileWidth, mobileHeight));
 } else {
 int desktopWidth = Integer.parseInt(System.getProperty("desktop.width", "1920"));
 int desktopHeight = Integer.parseInt(System.getProperty("desktop.height", "1080"));
 driver.manage().window().setSize(new Dimension(desktopWidth, desktopHeight));
 }
}

not working. it stack on default desktop","rich_text_json_repr":{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"its not working. it stack on default desktop"}]}]},"mentioned_items":[],"structured_output_nodes":[{"id":1,"type":0,"content":"The issue is that Maven properties aren't automatically passed as system properties to the JVM. You need to configure the Maven Surefire plugin to pass these properties. Update your `pom.xml`:

<augment_code_snippet path="pom.xml" mode="EDIT">
```xml
<plugin>
 <groupId>org.apache.maven.plugins</groupId>
 <artifactId>maven-surefire-plugin</artifactId>
 <version>3.2.2</version>
 <configuration>
 <systemPropertyVariables>
 <browser>${browser}</browser>
 <mode>${mode}</mode>
 <desktop.width>${desktop.width}</desktop.width>
 <desktop.height>${desktop.height}</desktop.height>
 <mobile.width>${mobile.width}</mobile.width>
 <mobile.height>${mobile.height}</mobile.height>
 </systemPropertyVariables>
 </configuration>
</plugin>
```
</augment_code_snippet>

Also update the Gauge Maven plugin to pass system properties:

<augment_code_snippet path="pom.xml" mode="EDIT">
```xml
<plugin>
 <groupId>com.thoughtworks.gauge.maven</groupId>
 <artifactId>gauge-maven-plugin</artifactId>
 <version>1.6.4</version>
 <configuration>
 <specsDir>specs</specsDir>
 <additionalFlags>
 <flag>-Dbrowser=${browser}</flag>
 <flag>-Dmode=${mode}</flag>
 <flag>-Ddesktop.width=${desktop.width}</flag>
 <flag>-Ddesktop.height=${desktop.height}</flag>
 <flag>-Dmobile.width=${mobile.width}</flag>
 <flag>-Dmobile.height=${mobile.height}</flag>
 </additionalFlags>
 </configuration>
 <executions>
 <execution>
 <phase>test</phase>
 <goals>
 <goal>execute</goal>
 </goals>
 </execution>
 </executions>
</plugin>
```
</augment_code_snippet>

Now you can run tests with:

```bash
# Mobile mode
gauge run specs -Dmode=mobile

# Desktop mode 
gauge run specs -Dmode=desktop

# Or with Maven
mvn test -Dmode=mobile
```

````xml path=pom.xml mode=EDIT
<plugin>
 <groupId>org.apache.maven.plugins</groupId>
 <artifactId>maven-surefire-plugin</artifactId>
 <version>3.2.2</version>
 <configuration>
 <systemPropertyVariables>
 <browser>${browser}</browser>
 <mode>${mode}</mode>
 <desktop.width>${desktop.width}</desktop.width>
 <desktop.height>${desktop.height}</desktop.height>
 <mobile.width>${mobile.width}</mobile.width>
 <mobile.height>${mobile.height}</mobile.height>
 </systemPropertyVariables>
 </configuration>
</plugin>
````

Also update the Gauge Maven plugin to pass system properties:

````xml path=pom.xml mode=EDIT
<plugin>
 <groupId>com.thoughtworks.gauge.maven</groupId>
 <artifactId>gauge-maven-plugin</artifactId>
 <version>1.6.4</version>
 <configuration>
 <specsDir>specs</specsDir>
 <additionalFlags>
 <flag>-Dbrowser=${browser}</flag>
 <flag>-Dmode=${mode}</flag>
 <flag>-Ddesktop.width=${desktop.width}</flag>
 <flag>-Ddesktop.height=${desktop.height}</flag>
 <flag>-Dmobile.width=${mobile.width}</flag>
 <flag>-Dmobile.height=${mobile.height}</flag>
 </additionalFlags>
 </configuration>
 <executions>
 <execution>
 <phase>test</phase>
 <goals>
 <goal>execute</goal>
 </goals>
 </execution>
 </executions>
</plugin>
````

Now you can run tests with:

```bash
# Mobile mode
gauge run specs -Dmode=mobile

# Desktop mode 
gauge run specs -Dmode=desktop

# Or with Maven
mvn test -Dmode=mobile
```

project"}]}]},"mentioned_items":[],"structured_output_nodes":[{"id":1,"type":0,"content":"To add Log4j to your project, you should replace the selected `slf4j-simple` dependency with Log4j. Here's how to update it:

<augment_code_snippet path="pom.xml" mode="EDIT">
```xml
<dependency>
 <groupId>org.apache.logging.log4j</groupId>
 <artifactId>log4j-core</artifactId>
 <version>2.21.1</version>
</dependency>
<dependency>
 <groupId>org.apache.logging.log4j</groupId>
 <artifactId>log4j-api</artifactId>
 <version>2.21.1</version>
</dependency>
<dependency>
 <groupId>org.apache.logging.log4j</groupId>
 <artifactId>log4j-slf4j2-impl</artifactId>
 <version>2.21.1</version>
</dependency>
```
</augment_code_snippet>

Also add the window size properties to your properties section:

<augment_code_snippet path="pom.xml" mode="EDIT">
```xml
<properties>
 <browser>firefox</browser>
 <mode>mobile</mode>
 <desktop.width>1920</desktop.width>
 <desktop.height>1080</desktop.height>
 <mobile.width>390</mobile.width>
 <mobile.height>844</mobile.height>
</properties>
```
</augment_code_snippet>

And update your Maven Surefire plugin to pass the window size properties:

<augment_code_snippet path="pom.xml" mode="EDIT">
```xml
<configuration>
 <systemPropertyVariables>
 <browser>${browser}</browser>
 <mode>${mode}</mode>
 <desktop.width>${desktop.width}</desktop.width>
 <desktop.height>${desktop.height}</desktop.height>
 <mobile.width>${mobile.width}</mobile.width>
 <mobile.height>${mobile.height}</mobile.height>
 </systemPropertyVariables>
</configuration>
```
</augment_code_snippet>

Now create a `log4j2.xml` configuration file:

<augment_code_snippet path="src/main/resources/log4j2.xml" mode="EDIT">
```xml
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<Configuration status="WARN">
 <Appenders>
 <Console name="Console" target="SYSTEM_OUT">
 <PatternLayout pattern="%d{HH:mm:ss.SSS} [%t] %-5level %logger{36} - %msg%n"/>
 </Console>
 <File name="FileAppender" fileName="logs/application.log">
 <PatternLayout pattern="%d{yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss.SSS} [%t] %-5level %logger{36} - %msg%n"/>
 </File>
 </Appenders>
 <Loggers>
 <Root level="INFO">
 <AppenderRef ref="Console"/>
 <AppenderRef ref="FileAppender"/>
 </Root>
 </Loggers>
</Configuration>
```
</augment_code_snippet>
